name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about North Carolina research and records.

choices.name: Get started with research for your North Carolina ancestors.

hidden.summary:
• Learn successful research strategies for North Carolina ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Selection Table to determine priorities for North Carolina research.

text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic North Carolina research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic North Carolina Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Get an overview of North Carolina research in this video.

    ☆ FS—North Carolina Overview—2:30

  3. Ancestry: Explore resources for North Carolina research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—North Carolina Resources
    ☆ AC—North Carolina State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  4. Record Finder: Use the North Carolina Record Selection Table to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—North Carolina Record Selection Table

    5. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
    4. Learn about research in colonial North Carolina.

      ☆ AC—Colonial North Carolina


    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in North Carolina in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for North Carolina
      ☆ FS—Wiki: North Carolina Minorities

    2. Learn more about African American records.

      ☆ AG—North Carolina African American Records

    3. Explore the African American Gateway for North Carolina.
    4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in North Carolina in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of North Carolina
Additional Records

1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
  4. Learn about research in colonial North Carolina.

    ☆ AC—Colonial North Carolina
Ethnic

1. African American: Learn about African Americans in North Carolina in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: North Carolina Minorities

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about North Carolina archives and libraries.

choices.name: Learn about North Carolina archives and libraries.

hidden.summary:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about North Carolina archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: North Carolina Archives and Libraries
    ☆ North_Carolina State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Learn more about North Carolina archives for research.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: North Carolina Archives—72:10



  3. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for North Carolina.
  4. Explore the North Carolina Digital Heritage Center for North Carolina.
  5. Explore the North Carolina State Archives site.
  6. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for North Carolina genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  7. Search for ☆free online books on North Carolina research on the FamilySearch site.
  8. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.summary:
• Explore city and county directories to find North Carolina ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about North Carolina city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: North Carolina Directories

  2. Sites: Explore North Carolina city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore North Carolina city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore North Carolina ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for North Carolina city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
QUIKLinks

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for North Carolina research.

text:
1. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  2. Explore links in ☆Linkpendium.
  3. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.
  4. Explore links in ☆LDSGenealogy.com.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or North Carolina County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for North Carolina.

text: Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the North Carolina Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your North Carolina research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

text:
1. Visit the North Carolina Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the North Carolina Genealogy - Just Ask! page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the North Carolina Genealogical Society page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the U.S. South Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for North Carolina.
Regional Groups

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about North Carolina research.
  2. Explore the North Carolina research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Explore the ☆FamilySearch community for help with North Carolina research.
  4. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about North Carolina research.

choices.name: Learn about North Carolina genealogy societies.

hidden.exercises: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in North Carolina in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: North Carolina Societies

  2. Explore the North Carolina Genealogical Society site.
  3. Explore North Carolina genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  4. Get help at a family history center in North Carolina.
